grid

Class Coordinate

  • java.lang.Object
    • grid.Coordinate

  • public class Coordinate
extends java.lang.Object
    A immutable Cartesian coordinate in a two dimensional plane. Each coordinate is represented by an X- and Y-coordinate. Position.ORIGIN represents a position in the upper left corner of the screen. If x represents an Integer then new Coordinate(x, 0) is a coordinate at the top of the screen. Similarly, if y represents an Integer then new Coordinate(0, y) is a coordinate on the left of the screen.
    Author:
    Bavo Mees

      • getCoordinateInDirection

        public Coordinate getCoordinateInDirection(Direction direction)
        returns a new coordinate in relative to this coordinate in a specified direction. The direction NORTH maps to a negative y-coordinate. The direction EAST maps to a positive x-coordinate. e.g.: Coordinate.ORIGIN.getCoordinateInDirection(Direction.NORTH).equals(new Coordinate(0, -1)) == true and Coordinate.ORIGIN.getCoordinateInDirection(Direction.EAST).equals(new Coordinate(1, 0)) == true
        Parameters:
        direction - the direction in which a new coordinate is returned
        Returns:
        a new coordinate relative to this coordinate

      • random

        public static Coordinate random(int x,
                int y)
        returns a new pseudorandom coordinate uniformly distributed between new Coordinate(0,0) (included) and new Coordinate(x, y) (excluded) within specified dimensions. The equality of the distribution is guaranteed by the the randomness of the nextInt(int) method.
        Parameters:
        x - The maximum x value
        y - The maximum y value
        Returns:
        A random Coordinate between (0,0) and (x,y)

      • getRandomCoordinateWithDistance

        public Coordinate getRandomCoordinateWithDistance(int distance)
        Get a random Coordinate with the specified distance from this Coordinate. This is used to build random walls in a grid.
        Parameters:
        distance - The distance the new Coordinate has to have from this Coordinate
        Returns:
        A Coordinate on the specified distance.

      • isNeighbour

        public boolean isNeighbour(Coordinate coordinate)
        returns whether a specified coordinate is a neighbor of this coordinate. More formally a coordinate is a neighbor of an other coordinate if and only if 
         Math.abs(coord1.getX() - coord2.getX()) <= 1
 && Math.abs(coord1.getY() - coord2.getY()) <= 1
        Parameters:
        coordinate - the coordinate to test
        Returns:
        True if the specified coordinate is a neighbor of this coordinate, otherwise false

      • getAllNeighbours

        public java.util.List<Coordinate> getAllNeighbours()
        Returns a list of all neigbouring coordinates.
        Returns:
        A list of neighbours: all Coordinates in this list will have isNeighbour(this) == true
